subject: RE: [junit] Multiple Asserts in a single Test case
msgSnippet: ... Based on the result of the first assert in what way? What is incorrect about the behaviour that you need to work around it?
messageBody:
>
> public void testPlain() throws Exception
> {
> assertEquals(1,1);
> assertEquals(2,1);
> }
>
> I always get only the result for last result:
>
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected:<2> but was:<1>
>
> Where as I want to design a test based on the result of first assert
> and I cannot devide them in to two test beds as the test has to be in
> single setup-TearDown. So is there any workaround for this I see lot
> of examples using multiple asserts in single test case, but why they
> are not succeeding in my case.
>

Based on the result of the first assert in what way?

What is incorrect about the behaviour that you need to work around it?
